title: OPM - Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending Women (Export-Import Bank of the United States)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OPM - Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending Women (Export-Import Bank of the United States)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

On January 29, 2025, Charles Ezell, Acting Director, U.S. Office of Personnel Management, sent a memo to all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies entitled "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending Women." Amongst other things, the memo instructed all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies to prepare two reports to be sent to  defendingwomen@opm.gov by February 7, 2025 at 12:00pm Eastern.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the complete list of actions taken in response to OPM's January 29, 2025 memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending
Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government "

2. A copy of any agency plans to fully comply with OPM's January 29, 2025 memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump’s Executive Order Defending
Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government "


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

communications.subject: FOIA 202500081F Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Neiss:

This email acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Export-Import Bank of the United States (EXIM), which we received in our FOIA office via email on February 10, 2025. We have designated your inquiry as FOIA Request # 202500081F. Please include this request number on all correspondence with the FOIA office.

You requested the following information:


  1.  A copy of the complete list of actions taken in response to OPM's January 29, 2025, memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump's Executive Order Defending Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government. "


  1.  A copy of any agency plans to fully comply with OPM's January 29, 2025, memo entitled: "Initial Guidance Regarding President Trump's Executive Order Defending Women" and the President's Executive Order entitled "Defending Women from Gender Ideology Extremism and Restoring Biological Truth to the Federal Government. "

We respond to requests on a first-in, first-out basis and on a multi-track system. Your request has been placed on the complex track. You may wish to narrow the scope of your request to identify specific documents in order to be eligible for the faster track. To do so, please send a written request, identifying the specific documents sought, to Export-Import Bank of the United States, 811 Vermont Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C., 20571, ATTN: FOIA OFFICER. You may also submit a narrowed request via E-Mail at foia@exim.gov<mailto:foia@exim.gov>. The phrase "Narrowed Request" should appear on the letter and on the outside of the envelope containing the narrowed request or in the "Subject" line of the E-Mail. Please include the request number listed above on all correspondence with the FOIA office. We will notify you if your request is placed in the simple track.

EXIM intends to disclose the requested records to the fullest extent of the law. Please be assured that we are processing your request as expeditiously as possible. However, the records you seek require a search in another Office, and so your request falls within "unusual circumstances." See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B)(i)-(iii). Because of these unusual circumstances, we need to extend the time limit to respond to your request beyond the ten additional days provided by the statute. We have not yet completed a search to determine whether there are records within the scope of your request. The time needed to process your request will necessarily depend on the complexity of our records search and the volume and complexity of any records located. In an effort to speed up your records search, you may wish to narrow the scope of your request to limit the number of potentially responsive records or agree to an alternative timeframe for processing, should records be located; or you may wish to await the completion of our records search to discuss either of these options.

If you have any questions or wish to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame for the processing of your request, you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison, Ms. Lennell Jackson at (202) 565-3290. Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

If you have any questions about this request, please feel free to contact me. Thank you.


Sincerely,


Lennell Jackson | FOIA Public Liaison
Export-Import Bank of the United States
811 Vermont Ave. NW | Washington, DC 20571
202-565-3290 | lennell.jackson@exim.gov
Twitter<https://twitter.com/EximBankUS> |  LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/company/eximbankus?trk=tyah>  |  YouTube<https://www.youtube.com/user/EximBankofUS> | Instagram<https://linkin.bio/eximbankus> | Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/eximbankus/>

communications.subject: FOIA 202500081F Status Update 3-21-25
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Neiss:

This e-mail is regarding your FOIA request to the Export-Import Bank of the United States (EXIM).

Please be advised, on February 18, 2025, our FOIA database experienced an outage. The outage affected our ability to access the system and deleted requests that were already in the system. We estimate we have lost requests submitted since November 2024. As of March 19, 2025, the system is partially available, and we are now able to proceed with accepting new requests and assigning accurate FOIA numbers for any requests received from February 14, 2025, through March 21, 2025. We are working with our vendor’s technical team to resolve any remaining issues and restore any deleted information as soon as possible. Please know we certainly understand the importance of your request and are working diligently to provide the information you have requested, but due to the outage it may take longer for us to provide our response.

The status of your request is as follows:

We have conducted the initial review and have submitted the documents to our Legal Division for review. Therefore, we estimate we will be able to provide a response within three weeks. Please note this is only an estimate.

We certainly understand the importance of your request and are working diligently to provide the information you have requested. Thank you for your continued patience.

Please let me know if you have any additional concerns regarding this matter. Thank you.


Sincerely,


Lennell Jackson | FOIA Public Liaison
Export-Import Bank of the United States
811 Vermont Ave, NW | Washington, DC 20571
lennell.jackson@exim.gov<mailto:lennell.jackson@exim.gov> | 202-565-3290

title: GA CVR Request (2020, 2022) (Jones County Elections Office)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA CVR Request (2020, 2022) (Jones County Elections Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2020 Nov General Election
2. 2022 Nov Midterm Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. Forsyth County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report” at this link: https://www.forsythco.com/Departments-Offices/Voter-Registrations-Elections/Election-Results. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: CPD Murders 2002

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPD Murders 2002
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all homicides and involuntary manslaughters recorded in Cook County in 2002, including but not limited to the following fields:
- Case or report number,
- Date of death,
- Victim name,
- Victim birth year,
- Victim race,
- Victim sex, 
- Location of incident,
- Cause of death,
- Weapon used, if applicable,
- Case status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled in the form of CSV or Excel file, and electronically by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Maggie  Dougherty, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded. 
 
Please click here to visit our (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXT2aAhmhBYiUcSShAuSz-2Fsuc8QsVv36mciHGQCY-2FePauQaOz_U5or8mN8C94KI-2BjCXX54SsLGv93m6h7e5Gs7t583YVZzgFt2e-2FZCiEye7jbAftsh3UwR1lCb7Wy-2FKPR2arWRDoblUkI8Y1IQCayK8VKU8F7KaiAMnjEofFalAX0xncdq1zPVWhb-2BeUCHP4DsmrriSdPQwqWl5ojWMJUkcp-2FhAyE468wuurr-2BqHWNuSN-2Bfo6CWO4ygRO25zZAKKJ2NHHq2l1aFookGir-2BeXCUdGv-2BIAs-3D) Chicago Public Records portal! communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: P036406-031625
communications.communication:
Dear Maggie : 
 
Thank you for your interest in information from the Chicago Police Department. Your FOIA request has been received and is being processed. Your FOIA Center reference number for tracking purposes is: P036406-031625 
You have requested the following records: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all homicides and involuntary manslaughters recorded in Cook County in 2002, including but not limited to the following fields:
- Case or report number,
- Date of death,
- Victim name,
- Victim birth year,
- Victim race,
- Victim sex,
- Location of incident,
- Cause of death,
- Weapon used, if applicable,
- Case status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a freelance reporter for Medill News and I am requesting this information in that editorial capacity.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled in the form of CSV or Excel file, and electronically by e-mail attachment if available.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Maggie Dougherty

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-police-department-503%252Fcpd-murders-2002-183200%252F%253Femail%253Dfoia%252540chicagopolice.org&url_auth_token=AAAjxj0IRUcm7btnNFjHnZe9RdI%3A1ttzum%3Ak48gF9SIYjF3CqgIoteUJtW-olRo5ImR3dzyXBmeVUE 
Chicago Police Department (CPD) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.  If further time is needed to assemble and copy all documents responsive to your FOIA request, we will contact you with a time estimate and a request to extend. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the Chicago FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA CVR Collection (2020, 2022) (Jones County Elections Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2020 Nov General Election
2. 2022 Nov Midterm Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. Forsyth County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report” at this link: https://www.forsythco.com/Departments-Offices/Voter-Registrations-Elections/Election-Results. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: VMI Enrollment and related records

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Enrollment and related records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of the enrollment data posted to the Office of Assessment and Institutional Research, Registrar and Board of Visitors Dashboard showing the Admissions summary and related data in the file(s) March 6, 2025.  As of March 6, 0225 the following links were active to documents (at least one in .PDF format) containing multiple pages of admissions, applications and enrollment data that VMI removed from the site so they are no longer accessible: 

https://www.vmi.edu/media/content-assets/documents/oie/VMI-Enrollment-Details.pdf

In addition to this specific document, all files in this root directory as of March 6, 2025 should be available:

https://www.vmi.edu/media/content-assets/documents/oie/

This page also had links to registration data that is not longer available:

https://www.vmi.edu/academics/support/registrar/registration-and-enrollment/

Goven these documents exist and were publically available as of March 6, 2025 there is not reason they cannot be provided expeditiously so no extension to the 5 day limit is justifiable. In addition, since these documents existed in those two directories and especially in https://www.vmi.edu/media/content-assets/documents/oie/ a charge to search for documents does not appear to be justified.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: FL SOS von Spakovsky communications

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FL SOS von Spakovsky communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All email communications (including email attachments, and complete email chains) between Secretary of State Cord Byrd (or anyone communicating on his behalf, including office staff) and Hans von Spakovsky (hans.vonspakovsky@heritage.org) sent or received between January 1, 2024 and the date this request is processed.

2) Any email communications, including full email chains and attachments, sent or received by Secretary of State Cord Byrd (or anyone communicating on his behalf, including office staff) between January 1, 2024 and the date this request is processed with the following keywords: "Hans von Spakovsky," "von Spakovsky," and/or "Spakovsky."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alice Herman

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the Oak Park Police Department’s Flock Safety system, specifically:

1.  All Flock related records delivered to the citizen police oversight body including, but not limited to the following:
1.1  Searches conducted by the department
1.2  Searches by outside agencies that included the department's Flock network
1.3  Flock Activity reports
1.4  Memos and other reports

2. Current data sharing that includes:
2.1  The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data, also referred to as "Networks that I’m sharing."
2.2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data, also referred to as "Flock networks shared with me."
2.3  The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists that I’m sharing."
2.4  The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists shared with me."

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

RTL

communications.subject: Submission Receipt - FOIA PDR2025-215
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you for submitting a FOIA request. Please cite the submission number in any future communications with our office regarding your request. Regular business hours to accept Freedom of Information Act Requests are Monday thru Friday, 7am-5pm. If your request is submitted outside of regular business hours, it will be entered the next business day. If your request is a personal request, please allow up to 5 business days to receive a response. If your request is a commercial request, allow up 21 business days to receive a response. If you do not see a response in your primary inbox, please check your spam inbox or the public portal. 
  
 In the event that the Village required clarification and no response received, the request will be deemed abandoned and closed after 30 days.

Physical copies of public records will be provided only upon payment of the applicable fee: 
  
 First 50 pages are free - 15 cents per each additional page or side of a page 
 Fees are for 8.5 inch x 11 inch, 8.5 inch x 14 inch and 11 inch x 17 inch pages only 
 DVDs, such as copies of Village Board meeting videos, are $1 each 
  
 Copies of materials in sizes or types other than indicated here are charged at the actual reproduction costs. GENERAL PROVISIONS (5 ILCS 140/) Freedom of Information Act

Copies of public records will not be mailed except upon prepayment of a fee equal to the actual cost of postage and copying. A $1 fee is charged to certify a public record.

All payments can be done through the online portal or in-person at the Village Hall.

This information can be used to track the status of your request at any time, and to download documents when they have been made available, here: https://url4102.request.justfoia.com/ls/click?upn=u001.nrfdmL-2B1UhWpB4V2ArB2sU9pEfGtLRTTTswk8UOOsefFJp8PHPc-2BlP15Es4v1GzegytAlFJLRyAg0K-2BaSUikng-3D-3DRbBB_cSdzTSAzIEe71wnvOfHu87cJtTSx6lwAYlxptlkl2fb-2ByQEpgGWZXGJnMtJTDtBCkONqc21oW9F9nNuUO9MFSkKmzxcDYyqZoIaWtYWlV4rgEf3S5Gu6KaJ2zdo3FjnxrHp5SwlyLNyoSSlLz2sAqbOAywe0iL1QuZaaBnhVV9n4slENTx748fg5-2BABZ1mDffspYj8PiSXQhITRGvX10eIvm11AqRqvaeTW482vA1u9-2Bi03uKZsQmV6ZUF0mxSk-2F6IgK6T64CwrFpzhD4Oqz6Pm2z2QyYHUEvR-2FQrPruMQEJpI-2FyxVUVEhb0gwtLUQAB

title: Cybercheck Communications & Contracts

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Cybercheck Communications & Contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Kankakee County Sheriff and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. All email exchanges, including attachments, between Kankakee County Sheriff staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. All emails, including attachments, between staff of Kankakee County Sheriff that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

I kindly request that you waive all fees as I am a journalist and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest.

If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request.

If you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jessica Hatcher

title: Clinton Library: Photographs of September 3rd 1993 Diplomatic Credentials Ceremony

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Clinton Library: Photographs of September 3rd 1993 Diplomatic Credentials Ceremony
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All photographs either taken by White House photographers or otherwise held by the Library which include or feature President Clinton at the State Department on September 3rd of 1993 at a diplomatic credentials ceremony at the State Department. 

On September 3rd of 1993, President Clinton received diplomatic credentials from: Ambassadors Tuiloma Neroni Slade of Western Samoa, Carlo Jagmetti of Switzerland, Koumbairia Laoumaye Mekonyo of Chad, Toomas Hendrik Ilves of Estonia, Peter P. Chkheidze of the Republic of Georgia, Loucas Tsilas of Greece, Paul Boundoukou-Latha of Gabon, Marc Michael Marengo of Seychelles, Raul C. Rabe of the Philippines, and Odeen Ishmael of Guyana at a ceremony at the State Department.

This meeting is described here:
https://www.govinfo.gov/content/pkg/PPP-1993-book2/html/PPP-1993-book2-app-pg2209.htm

This is a request for photographs from that day. I am especially interested in photographs of Peter Chkheidze. 

Thank you for your commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working together until this request is resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. Forsyth County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report” at this link: https://www.forsythco.com/Departments-Offices/Voter-Registrations-Elections/Election-Results. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

During the September executive session Maj. Gen Wins briefed: "There was an out of house consortium that was created and there are some alumni who recognizing kind of how fast this thing is moving, they went and got involved in this consortium where they are some cadet athletes, basketball players. There's an agreement on them here. Now there's two other features that are separate from the NIL. There's an Academic Achievement Fund, which we did. Okay. And the Academic Achievement Fund is set up in such a way where if you stay at VMI and you perform academically at a certain level, right, then you would get a sum of money and I'm pretty sure academic achievement was upon graduation. There's a second one that's called the Austin Fund which operates similarly. Okay. And I know that that one is upon graduation you would get this the equivalent of I believe $5,000 a year. Right. For four years. So when you graduate in four years, the Austin fund would get you somewhere about $20,000. You have those, those two arrangements as well, which we are participating in right now. It largely affects only basketball. It largely only affects basketball." He also briefed that the budget projection is based on increased ticket sales. He also mentioned "Jamal" attended a Keydet Club meeting covering the NIL and consortiuum and has the slides and other materials from that. This FOIA requests 

1. Records showing the struture, operations and policies of the NIL consortiuum Maj. Gen. Wins Mentioned. Again, these records include Keydet Club and Alumni Agencies slides, documents, agreements, and other materials given to him that, as a result, become discloseable Public Records.
2. Records showing the amunt paid out of the Academic Achievement Fund since its creation and THE SOURCE OF THOSE FUNDS (student fees, donors (who?), state funds, etc.).
3. Records showing how much, if anything, cadets are charged or any funds form cadet athletic or other student fees for admission to or their attendence at NCAA Football and NCAA basketball events regardless if these are considered "tickets" or not for the past 2 academic years.

#1 and especially #3 should be readily available and should not take more than the 5 day maximum. I am willing to accept any of these immediately available rather than wait for all records if needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: FOIA Request: Sanitation Complaints & Violations – Clinton (March 2024 - March 2025)

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: FOIA Request: Sanitation Complaints & Violations – Clinton (March 2024 - March 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. All sanitation-related complaints filed about Clinton from March 1, 2024 – March 1, 2025.

2. Any inspections, citations, or enforcement actions issued to the City of Clinton for waste management violations in the same period.

3. Any reports or assessments regarding public health or environmental risks caused by uncollected waste or sanitation failures in Clinton.

4. Any communications (emails, memos, meeting notes) between SC DHEC and Clinton officials regarding sanitation concerns or waste management policies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Chadwick

title: 2015 and 2018 Crime Incidents Request

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: 2015 and 2018 Crime Incidents Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2015 and 2018
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Canyon County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Idaho Public Records Act Request: Third Party Investigative Platform (Purchase and Contract records) (Canyon County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Idaho Public Records Act, I hereby request the records listed below regarding the following four software programs: 

• Thompson Reuters Clear (https://legal.thomsonreuters.com/en/products/clear)
• LexisNexis Accurint (https://www.accurint.com/)
• TransUnion TLOxp, which may also be part of the TruLookup system (https://www.tlo.com/law-enforcement)
• SoundThinking CrimeTracer, which was formerly a product called COPLINK X (https://www.soundthinking.com/law-enforcement/crime-analysis-crimetracer/) from the company formerly known as ShotSpotter

For each of the above mentioned platforms, please provide the following records: 

• CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS —  All contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits) and agreements related to the acquisition and use of these "software" programs.
• PURCHASE INFORMATION — All invoices and purchase information for costs and products associated with the above-referenced platforms.

Please provide responsive materials for the period from January 1, 2021 through the date this request is processed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Blum

title: Eduardo Castro Interrogation

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Eduardo Castro Interrogation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request for the interrogation video of Eduardo Castro, who was interviewed by Dallas Police Department
Additionally, I also ask for Angela Samota' crime scene reports from October 13, 2005
and any recordings of 911 calls that are accessible.
as well as any additional case-related investigative materials and Photos. Thanks Mahad

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mahad Mohammed

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Dallas Open Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Mahad Mohammed, 
Thank you for registering with the City of Dallas Open Records Center. Your Login ID is:  181627-30699166@requests.muckrock.com If you did not submit your request through the Records Center but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.aGJs94H2n3wB3Vxe3mxzET5y5yKFxs6Xf2fP3YbdNeRdF-2FWMG-2FwrlOA-2BWfh33WYhfzhV8V-2FIPE8aD92a-2Fddehg-3D-3D4JKb_iWV1IbgQPtOqZw812kEshMjoKYAPAH0O37RokNMBph9Sm8ivTBmwzL3itPva4gJgazPOiImevKHsTxgAqbtN76K81pFoDYQyfFiqonfkMslUSZLED872G-2BGTLBbJeThAxzRYZFKbgvEPr6ENaFNhhy2JoIWDzVByVb6RA2tSDzRmy8ue3KWskeKCJY1AJprz-2FVok48FboLjuyVnEo03ILd-2BEqU9iLBYkGdJJPaUgfiQ-3D) Please log in to the Records Center to update any contact or password information and to track the progress of your request. 
 Effective September 1, 2019, the process for requesting public records from the City of Dallas will change in response to the state’s adoption of Senate Bill 944. The Texas Legislature amended the Public Information Act to specify exactly how members of the public may submit a public information request to a governmental agency. To comply with the law, all emailed public information requests, including requests for the Dallas Police Department, must be sent to openrecords@dallascityhall.com. (mailto:openrecords@dallascityhall.com) Any requests emailed to the address associated with police records requests will be deemed not received. openrecordunit@dpd.ci.dallas.tx.us (mailto:openrecordunit@dpd.ci.dallas.tx.us) 
 
 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

title: Public Records Request – April 29, 2023 DUI Arrest of Deputy Jonathon Michael Lane

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – April 29, 2023 DUI Arrest of Deputy Jonathon Michael Lane
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request access to and copies of all records related to the arrest of Deputy Jonathon Michael Lane on April 29, 2023, in Ramrod Key, Monroe County, Florida. Deputy Lane, 27, was found off-duty and asleep at the wheel of his personal vehicle at a gas station around 2 a.m. He was subsequently arrested for DUI and placed on administrative leave without pay pending an Internal Affairs investigation.

I am requesting the following records related to this incident:

All available body-worn camera footage from deputies involved in the response and arrest of Deputy Jonathon Michael Lane.
All available dashboard camera (dashcam) footage from patrol vehicles present at the scene.
The complete incident and arrest reports, including all officer narratives, supplemental reports, and witness statements.
All 911 call recordings and dispatch logs related to this incident, including radio communications and Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) reports.
Any photographs taken by the Monroe County Sheriff's Office during or after the arrest, including images of the suspect, his vehicle, and the scene.
The full arrest affidavits and any related charging documents filed in this case.
Any internal reviews, use-of-force reports, or investigations conducted by the Monroe County Sheriff's Office regarding this incident.
Any press releases, social media posts, or official statements made by the Monroe County Sheriff's Office regarding this incident.
The primary goal of this request is to serve the public interest by making these records publicly accessible. While I acknowledge that I may also generate revenue from disseminating these materials, the request primarily aims to enhance transparency regarding this law enforcement incident.

I request a waiver of fees associated with fulfilling this request, as disclosure of the requested information will contribute to public understanding of law enforcement practices and actions. However, if a full fee waiver is not possible, please inform me of the estimated costs in advance. Additionally, if fees can be reduced or eliminated by excluding certain records, please specify which records those would be.

Please provide the records in an electronic format if available. If any portions of this request are denied, please cite the specific legal exemption(s) and provide a redacted version of the document where applicable.

I appreciate your time and assistance in this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: Patron Incident Reports - Feb 2 2025

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Patron Incident Reports - Feb 2 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All Patron Incident Reports submitted for the Area Manager 5 North Region from February 18, 2025 through February 28, 2025 inclusive of those dates.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs for the purpose of public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

title: Patron Incident Reports - September 2023

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Patron Incident Reports - September 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

All Patron Incident Reports submitted for the Area Manager 5 North Region in September 2023.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit Lucy Parsons Labs for the purpose of public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

title: FBI Minutemen 11.22.21

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Minutemen 11.22.21
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

All bureau files covering investigations into the Minutemen organization in the following cities: Chicago (105-11643), Los Angeles (62-5101), Miami (105-4921), Phoenix (105-1226), and San Diego (100-12461). The Minutemen were a right-wing paramilitary group founded in June 1960 by businessman Robert Bolivar DePugh and operated in some capacity in cities throughout the United States between 1960 and 1969. The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has already made public files on Robert Bolivar DePugh and Minutemen operations in cities like New York City, so I am asking the FBI provide copies of files on these additional cities so the public may have a greater understanding of this organization and its place within the social unrest of the sixties.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records.

I am a member of the news media, and I am asking you waive any fees associated with this request. I have written for Philly Voice and Atlas Obscura. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. All documents will be provided to the general public without charge.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $250. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

    Robert Skvarla, Jr.
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ffbi-minutemen-112221-121475%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2OUyZW-3jnbyK8lotyHikw8%3A1mpM6J%3AJ7tnw5T1uTrK1peaKA9zrpbNKx4

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1510574-000
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 152 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 922 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,964 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1510574-000
communications.communication:
To FOIA Appeals Officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information (FOIA) Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am appealing the following:

On November 22, 2022, I submitted Freedom of Information/Privacy Acts (FOIPA) request number 1510574-000 via MuckRock seeking all Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) records on the Chicago chapter of paramilitary group the Minutemen. At that time, I included the chapter’s Bureau file number (105-11643) for reference purposes.

On June 16, 2022, I received a response letter from the FBI releasing only one page from the chapter’s Bureau file and rejecting the rest of my request. The rejection letter cited FOIA exemptions (b)(3) 50 U.S.C., § 3024 (i)(1), (b)(6), (b)(7)(c), and (b)(7)(e). I am appealing these exemptions for the following reasons:

(b)(6) and (b)(7)(c): Exemptions (b)(6) and (b)(7)(c) are written to protect the rights of individuals against a clear and unwarranted “invasion of personal privacy,” with (b)(6) specifically covering personnel and medical files. First, I am not requesting personnel or medical files; I am asking for files from investigations into a right-wing paramilitary group. I believe exemption (b)(6) may have been included in error and request a review of this exemption.

Next, persons and groups may retain privacy rights under some circumstances, but, per the United States Court of Appeals, District Columbia Circuit, in Fund for Constitutional Government v. National Archives & Records Service, these rights yield “where exceptional interests militate in favor of disclosure.” Through actions and public statements made by Minuteman founder Robert Bolivar DePugh, the Minutemen and any subsequent chapters have no expectations of privacy because they are figures of exceptional public interest. Mr. DePugh spoke at length with newspapers about the group and participated in an unofficial biography, published in 1968 under the title "The Minutemen" (later re-released in 1969 as "A Private Army").

Additionally, the FBI has already released files on Robert Bolivar DePugh and the Minutemen to researcher John Greenwald, Jr. in 2018, as part of FOIPA request number 1415062-000 (attached under "1510574-000 Appeal Documents"). Other files on the New York City chapter were released to researcher Ernie Lazar prior to that (attached under "1510574-000 Appeal Documents"). These documents are publicly accessible in a variety of formats as of the writing of this appeal; Mr. Greenwald’s can be found on his site, The Black Vault, while Mr. Lazar’s are collected at the Internet Archive. Privacy concerns cannot be re-extended to figures where they have already been waived or determined no longer applicable.

(b)(3) 50 U.S.C., § 3024 (i)(1) and (b)(7)(e): These exemption cover information that disclose “intelligence sources and methods” and “techniques and procedures for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions, or would disclose guidelines for law enforcement investigations or prosecutions if such disclosure could reasonably be expected to risk circumvention of the law." However, these would not apply as the group in question, the Minutemen, ceased operations and disbanded in the 1970s. Although individuals may have claimed to revive the group at various points since then, there are no active chapters of the Minutemen at this time. The group’s founder, Robert Bolivar DePugh, passed away on June 30, 2009 (attached as "Minuteman outlasted notoriety..."). In the absence of a functioning body and the death of Mr. DePugh, the release of these files would not risk circumvention of the law by any living parties.

Many of the intelligence sources for the FBI have also been disclosed elsewhere. These individuals include: Michael Desmond Sadewhite, who served as a Bureau informant from 1966 until 1967 (attached under "1510574-000 Appeal Documents"); Henry Edward Warren, who disclosed information on the Minutemen from 1966 to 1968; and Jerry Milton Brooks, who testified against Mr. DePugh in 1966 and later claimed to have worked as an informant for both the FBI and then-Alcohol and Tobacco Tax Unit. These individuals have all been identified publicly in newspaper articles during the 1960s and 1970s or in J. Harry Jones’s book "The Minutemen".

Also, as previously mentioned, documents containing information about Mr. DePugh and the Minutemen have been released in other FOIPA releases in the past. Any concerns over disclosures with regard to intelligence sources or law enforcement investigation techniques or methods would have been voided upon the release of those documents.

Finally, I am renewing my request for a fee waiver. I am a member of the news media, with bylines including CovertAction Magazine, Janata Weekly, and Philly Voice. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

Thank you for your prompt response to this appeal. I appreciate the work that the FBI's Information Management Division does in processing FOIA requests and disseminating eligible material. As provided in 5 U.S.C. subsection 552(a)(6)(A)(ii), I anticipate that you will produce responsive documents within twenty (20) working days of receipt of this appeal.

Sincerely,
Robert Skvarla, Jr.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1510700-000
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I recently received two letters, attached, from Michael G. Seidel, Section Chief of the Record/Information Dissemination Section, Information Management Division, inquiring if I would like to continue with FOIPA requests 1510698-000 and 1510700-000, for information on the Minutemen organiation. Please consider this communication confirmation of my intention to continue with these requests. No circumstances have changed on my end, and I am still very much interested in obtaining these records.

I would also like to take this opportunity to renew my request for a fee waiver. My bylines include Unicorn Riot, Covert Action Magazine, and the Geopolitical Economy Report and I am sending this request in coordination with Muckrock, an award-winning and nationally-recognized news organization. Please take note of the Office of Management and Budget guidelines published March 27, 1987 (52 FR 10012) that include electronic publications and other nontraditional publishers as representatives of the news media.

Thank you for your guidance through the FOIPA process. I greatly appreciate the work the FBI's Information Management Division does in reviewing and releasing all eligible records.

Best,
Robert Skvarla, Jr.

title: All Caps

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: All Caps
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Transcript of all captioned media.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: FOIA Request  24-00055-F
communications.communication:
October 6, 2023 RE: FOIA Request No.  24-00055-F: 
Dear Remy Noìchlaf: 
This letter is in response to your request for informationpursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, datedOctober 5, 2023 and received in this office on October 6, 2023. 
You requested the following: “Pursuant to the Freedom of InformationAct, I hereby request the following records: Transcript of all captioned media.” 
In order to process your request more effectively, we needclarification of the information that you requested.  The information needed is as follows: 
Please specify the records you are seeking, as well as adate range for the documents. Please also specify which office to search forrecords, you can find the Department's organization chart at https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/or/index.html. (https://www2.ed.gov/about/offices/or/index.html) 
Please provide the clarification requested above within ten(10) business days from the date of this letter. Once we receive theinformation, we will assign your request to the appropriate office(s) to searchfor documents responsive to your request. If no response is received within thetime frame provided above, your request will be administratively closed. 
If you have any questions, please contact the FOIA ServiceCenter (FSC) at 202-401-8365 or EDFOIAManager@ed.gov. (mailto:EDFOIAManager@ed.gov) 
Sincerely, 
ED FOIA Manager 
GovernmentInformation Specialist 
Office of theSecretary

communications.communication: To clarify, please search your Office of Special Education Programs (OSEP) for all captioned media for years between 1979 and 2024. I understand you may need to consult with other parties, therefore I suggest working with your IT departments as well to search for vendors for captioning who use plug-ins within video editing software like those I have observed in Burbank. There may be more records at those Post Production facilities or vaults as they have been called.

communications.subject: Department of Education FOIA Request 24-00055-F
communications.communication:
Good day,

On 10/6/23, we reached out to you seeking clarification pertaining to your FOIA request, 24-00055-F. Thank you for your 10/9/23 PAL messaging response, but we still require further clarification.

You are seeking "all captioned media for years between 1979 and 2024" within the "Office of Special Education Programs (OSEP)".

Please identify what program or event within OSEP you are seeking media and the accompanying transcripts from. OSEP hosts different programs annually. In addition, please specify what type of media you are seeking (video, audio etc.).

If it is helpful to you, OSEP posts videos with transcripts to the Office of Special Education and Rehabilitative Services YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/@OSERS

Please let me know if you have any questions or comments.

Thank you!

Michael Tobias
FOIA Service Center
Office of the Secretary
U.S. Department of Education
400 Maryland Ave. SW
Washington, DC  20202-4510
FOIA Hotline (202) 401-8365

communications.subject: FOIA Request  24-00055-F
communications.communication:
Dear Remy Noìchlaf: 
This letter is in response to your request for informationpursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, dated October 5, 2023  and received in this office on October 23, 2023. Your request has been attached to this email. In your original request, you were seeking "Transcript of all captioned media". 

On October 9, 2023, in response to a request for clarification, you narrowed your request to the following "please search your Office of Special Education Programs (OSEP) for all captioned media for years between 1979 and 2024". 

On November 1, 2023, we asked for further clarification and you responded with the following "I am seeking transcripts of all captioned media. Your YouTube channel was mentioned as a possible source though I am seeking record that features transcripts for television, music, movies, training videos, etc, an all encompassing manifest of transcription by your agency that has not been fully addressed by the public". 

Based on your October 9, 2023 communication, we are interpreting your request as all captioned media (television, music, movies, training videos, etc.) within Office of Special Education Programs between 1979 and 2024. 

Please let me know if this interpretation is accurate. If it is not accurate and you are seeking all Department of Education's captioned media, please refer back to our original request for clarification sent on October 6, 2023. 

I happy to discuss further if you have any questions. 
Thank you! 

Michael Tobias 
Government InformationSpecialist 
FOIA Service Center 
Office of the Secretary 
U.S. Department of Education 
(202) 401-8365 FOIA Hotline

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00055-F
communications.communication:
Good day,

This is a status update regarding your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552, dated October 5, 2023, and received in the U.S. Department of Education’s (Department) FOIA Service Center (FSC) on October 23, 2023.

When received, your request was forwarded to the appropriate office(s) within the Department to conduct a search for any responsive records. At this time, your request is still being processed.

We appreciate your patience as we work diligently to process your request. Please be advised that the average request processing time is approximately 185 business days. As this is an average, your request may take more time or may be processed sooner. You can check the status of your request at https://foiaxpress.pal.ed.gov/app/CheckStatus.aspx.

Narrowing or reformulating a request can often lead to decreased processing times. If you are interested in reformulating or narrowing your request, or have any other questions, please contact the FSC at 202-401-8365 or EDFOIAManager@ed.gov<mailto:EDFOIAManager@ed.gov>.

You have the right to seek assistance and/or dispute resolution services from the Department’s FOIA Public Liaison or the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS). The FOIA Public Liaison is responsible, among other duties, for assisting in the resolution of FOIA disputes. The FOIA Public Liaison may also assist in reformulating or narrowing your request. OGIS, which is outside the Department, offers ombuds services, including dispute resolution, to assist FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. You may contact the FOIA Public Liaison or OGIS at:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Oct. 5, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #24-00055-F.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00055-F
communications.communication:
Good day,

I do appreciate your patience and apologize for the delay. At this time, your request is still being processed.

Please be advised that the average request processing time is approximately 185 business days. At this time, we are estimating that processing will be complete by November 5, 2024.  As this is an only an estimate, your request may take more time or may be processed sooner. You can check the status of your request at https://foiaxpress.pal.ed.gov/app/CheckStatus.aspx.

Thank you!

Michael Tobias
FOIA Service Center
Office of the Secretary
U.S. Department of Education
400 Maryland Ave. SW
Washington, DC  20202-4510
FOIA Hotline (202) 401-8365

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-00055-F
communications.communication:
Good day,

I apologize for the delay in getting back to you. Your request is still being processed. I will look into this request and provided an updated estimated completion date early next week.

We appreciate your patience as we work diligently to process your request. Please be advised that the average request processing time is approximately 185 business days. As this is an average, your request may take more time or may be processed sooner. You can check the status of your request at https://foiaxpress.pal.ed.gov/app/CheckStatus.aspx.


Narrowing or reformulating a request can often lead to decreased processing times. If you are interested in reformulating or narrowing your request, or have any other questions, please contact the FSC at 202-401-8365 or EDFOIAManager@ed.gov<mailto:EDFOIAManager@ed.gov>.



You have the right to seek assistance and/or dispute resolution services from the Department’s FOIA Public Liaison or the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS). The FOIA Public Liaison is responsible, among other duties, for assisting in the resolution of FOIA disputes. The FOIA Public Liaison may also assist in reformulating or narrowing your request. OGIS, which is outside the Department, offers ombuds services, including dispute resolution, to assist FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. You may contact the FOIA Public Liaison or OGIS at:



FOIA Public Liaison

Office of the Secretary

U.S. Department of Education

400 Maryland Ave., SW, LBJ 7W104

Washington, DC 20202-4500

Email: robert.wehausen@ed.gov<mailto:robert.wehausen@ed.gov>

Phone: 202-205-0733

Fax: 202-401-0920



Office of Government Information Services

National Archives and Records Administration

8601 Adelphi Road, OGIS

College Park, MD 20740-6001

Email: OGIS@nara.gov<mailto:OGIS@nara.gov>

Phone: 202-741-5770 or 1-877-684-6448


Thank you!

Michael Tobias
FOIA Service Center
Office of the Deputy Secretary
U.S. Department of Education
400 Maryland Ave. SW
Washington, DC  20202-4510
FOIA Hotline (202) 401-8365
